headline: ERI’s David Revis Describes the Critical Role of Sustainability at 2025 ITAD Summit
summary: LOUISVILLE, Ky., September 16, 2025--Last week, David Revis, Director of Environmental, Health, Safety & Security for ERI, the nation’s first carbon neutral resource recovery, ITAD, mobility and data destruction/processing provider, participated in a panel conversation last week at the Alliance of Hazardous Materials Professionals’ (AHMP’s) EHS Hazardous Materials Conference in Louisville, Kentucky.

content.title: ERI’s David Revis Describes the Critical Role of Sustainability at 2025 ITAD Summit
content.summary: LOUISVILLE, Ky., September 16, 2025--Last week, David Revis, Director of Environmental, Health, Safety & Security for ERI, the nation’s first carbon neutral resource recovery, ITAD, mobility and data destruction/processing provider, participated in a panel conversation last week at the Alliance of Hazardous Materials Professionals’ (AHMP’s) EHS Hazardous Materials Conference in Louisville, Kentucky.

headline: Corporate Tax Collections Decline as New Law Kicks In
summary: The corporate tax cuts that Congress passed in July are starting to show up in lower federal revenue.  According to Treasury Department data released Tuesday, the government collected $47.1 billion in gross corporate tax revenue in the final two days before Monday’s quarterly estimated tax payment deadline.  The new law, known as President Trump’s “one big, beautiful bill,” let companies accelerate tax deductions for research expenses and equipment purchases.
